title: HTTP Error! (RIOT PLEASE READ)
body: Ok, so i was just playing League of Legends minding my own buisness until i had to go somewhere. Then i thought it wouldn't take as long so i kept LoL on and no i did not go AFK in the middle of a match, i went AFK in the home screen. But then when i came back its said something about a error or something with a red triangle near the play button. Because it wouldn't go away i just exited the game and tried going back on, but this is the part which led me to making this thread. When i pressed my League of Legends shortcut this is what it said..."Could not connect to the HTTP server, please check that your internet connection is enabled and that your Firewall is not blocking access" I really want to play League of Legends again soon but have no clue on fixing this error. If you could tell me how that would be amazing! Riot please read this and respond or fix this error. Any tips on the Firewall part you can tell me. Thank you in advance. -Nagasaki Reborn

replies.body: I tried a bunch of things and it didn't work, but it seems like the problem has been resolved for me now. Flush your DNS and try your client, it'll probably work for you too now. Try changing your DNS to the Google public ones (8.8.8.8 and 8.8.8.4)
Thank you for your help! But i'd really like if you would tell me that step by step on what to do. For me all that you said was alittle to hard to understand...
I have no sympathy for people who are unable to use Google, sorry mate. I gave you the terms. "change your DNS" "flush DNS" etc. Learn how to learn, stop asking people to spoonfeed you.

Not everyone is as computer savvy as you. Some people just want to sit down and play the game.

It the same vein that it doesn't take much effort to search up instructions on how to do it yourself, it doesn't take much effort to instruct someone else on how to do it. If not that, then at least link them to instructions which they can follow.

What is the point of the help and support boards?

I'm not going to reward laziness. I didn't deny that it wouldn't be hard to just help him out, but it does not take computer savvyness to type "how to change my DNS" into Google. If he learns to seek out answers himself, he'll save countless hours of his own time in the future, and not waste others' time. You literally made his life worse in return for short term gratification by giving him the information.

I pointed him in the right direction. That's what a help and support board is for. If he wants to be spoonfed, he should contact Riot Support and not the player base. Riot is using people like you as free labor, I hope you enjoy being used.

What if you don't use Google? Don't make the presumption everyone just loves using search engines, giving away all their personal details so that a wealthy internet company can sell them to third-party advertisers to gain a lot of profit for espionage.

ugh

What I'm saying is that the help and support boards is to help and support people, not just redirect them. And hell, if you are really that lazy yourself, you could at least link them to Riot's support page. The reason of this boards existence is so that people can try to get an answer instantly from people who may have already fixed it themselves.

And I don't consider helping others out to be 'labour'.

[Riot's official instructions.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq4)

In summary, go to Control Panel>Network And Internet>Network And Sharing Center>Change adapter settings. Right-click your adapter and go to Properties (need to be an admin). Scroll down the box list until you find "Internet Protocol Version 4 (TCP/IPv4)", select it that and then click Properties (do not remove the check mark). And then you're at the DNS address page.

Hope that helps.

'Allo.

Some other people are experiencing this as well, i.e. they have perfectly fine internet but suddenly League cannot connect any more.

It's only effecting some people. I suggest you follow some of the other threads on it as well as your own. Unfortunately the reds haven't noticed yet.
Yep, Ever since this error got on my LoL i started getting more interest in the forums because most stuff on Youtube fake. But everywhere i checked it seems like most people can't fix it.
In case someone reads my thread please give me at least some suggestions to fix this error and comment!
